columns.address_content: The main line of the address including street details.
columns.other_address_details: The additional information regarding the address.
columns.country: The nation where the address is located.
columns.address_id: The unique identifier for each address entry.
columns.state_province_county: The specific state, province, or county of the address.
columns.city: The city where the address is situated.
columns.zip_postcode: The postal code for the address.

Addresses.table_description: The table stores addresses linked to customers.

columns.product_id: The unique identifier for each product entry.
columns.product_details: The description of the product including its name.

Products.table_description: The table stores products available for customer orders.

columns.customer_id: The unique identifier for each customer.
columns.payment_method: The method used for payment, such as cash or credit card.
columns.customer_name: The full name of the customer.
columns.date_became_customer: The date and time when the customer registered.
columns.other_customer_details: The additional information related to the customer.

Customers.table_description: The table stores customer information for transactions.

columns.order_id: The unique identifier for each order made by customers.
columns.customer_id: The unique identifier for the customer placing the order.
columns.order_status: The current status of the order, such as Delivered or Cancelled.
columns.order_date: The date and time when the order was placed.
columns.order_details: The additional information related to the order.

Customer_Orders.table_description: The table stores orders placed by customers with their details.

columns.customer_id: The unique identifier for each customer associated with an address.
columns.address_id: The unique identifier for each address linked to a customer.
columns.date_address_from: The date when the customer started using the address.
columns.address_type: The category of the address, such as Billing or Residential.
columns.date_address_to: The date when the customer stopped using the address.

Customer_Addresses.table_description: The table links customers to their addresses over specified time periods.

columns.customer_id: The unique identifier for each customer associated with a contact channel.
columns.channel_code: The type of contact channel, such as Mobile or Email.
columns.active_from_date: The date and time when the contact channel became active.
columns.active_to_date: The date and time when the contact channel was deactivated.
columns.contact_number: The phone number or identifier for the contact channel.

Customer_Contact_Channels.table_description: The table stores contact channels linked to customers with their active periods.

columns.product_id: The unique identifier for each product in the order.
columns.order_id: The unique identifier for the order containing the items.
columns.order_quantity: The quantity of each product ordered in the transaction.

Order_Items.table_description: The table stores items associated with each customer order.
